data.title: OK hotel with good location
data.text:
The room was fine, but check-in was not great.  We arrived early, a little after one, and asked if the room was ready.  I was told a half an hour and they suggested we go get some coffee in the restaurant.  We went to the restaurant, and were basically ignored once they realized that all we wanted was coffee - no refills, hard to get the check.  After forty five minutes we went back and were told the room wasn't quite ready and to wait in the lobby.  Another thirty minutes and the room wasn't ready.  At that point I told them we had wasted enough time waiting and we were going out and would come back after the check in time.  We walked over to the National Geographic exhibit and then came back, after check in time, and we still had to wait a few minutes for the room.  I get that we were early and understand the room might not be ready, but just tell me, don't let me waste a couple of hours waiting when we could have just left our luggage and gone sightseeing.

We also ate at the hotel on Saturday night and had a much better experience than when we went for coffee.  Good food, good service, and reasonable prices.

The internet policy was a bit frustrating.  We had a package that came with half price parking (which was why we chose the hotel) but it only came with internet for one device.

owner_response.author: SteveRipai, General Manager at Beacon Hotel & Corporate Quarters, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are terribly sorry that your stay did not start off as smooth as we would have liked for you. We will certainly discuss this with the teams involved to ensure future stays are not inconvenienced. We trust the rest of your stay went well and hope you were able to enjoy the National Geographic museum, there’s a lot of neat exhibits to see right now. Thanks for taking the time to share a comment regarding your recent stay and we look forward to welcoming you back.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Craptacular
data.text:
What a disappointment. Started from when the taxi pulled up 3 bell boys just stood and watched, then expected after I checked in to help with my bags. No guys it doesn't work like that. Bad luck you miss out on the tip there.
The room had no compendium so we don't know what is where in the hotel, had to ring reception to find out about dry cleaning. 
For the price we pay for this hotel I would suggest to everyone to find something else this place is a massive disappointment

owner_response.author: SteveRipai, General Manager at Beacon Hotel & Corporate Quarters, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are terribly sorry you were disappointed in your stay, please trust us in saying that is never our intention. We will certainly discuss your claim with the bell staff to ensure that they are more proactive. All guest rooms do contain compendiums on the desk with valuable information regarding the hotel and the amenities we offer. We apologize if you could find it and for any inconvenience it may have caused you. We certainly hope you will be able to give us another chance.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great location
data.text: This hotel is located in the center of DC, this is the perfect place for the first timer in DC because all are walking distance from restaurants, parks, museums and shopping malls. The staffs are nice and friendly. I will stay again in this hotel on my next visit in DC.

owner_response.author: SteveRipai, General Manager at Beacon Hotel & Corporate Quarters, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks so much for staying at the Beacon Hotel. You are absolutely correct, we are centrally located in the city. One of the great things about us is that we are walking distance to so many great attractions, eateries, and entertainment. We hope you were able to see/do a lot while you were a guest of ours and we look forward to welcoming you back!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Adequate hotel with decent location
data.text: Stayed twice in one month.  First time room was small but adequate and clean.  Front desk and bell service were very good.  Hotel was very quiet.  Have eaten brunch here on an earlier visit and found it fine.  The second time we stayed this month, the room had a mini kitchen with fridge, burners, dishes etc.  Much nicer and larger room.  However, the bathroom could have been cleaner.  Hate to see darkness between the tiles.  Suggests mold.  Wasn't bad enough to complain about but would watch for it next time as soon as I check in.

owner_response.author: SteveRipai, General Manager at Beacon Hotel & Corporate Quarters, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks so much for being a repeat guest. We're glad both stays were great for you and we will certainly investigate into your comment about the bathroom. Thank you for taking the time to share valuable information with us and we look forward to welcoming you back!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great hotel!
data.text: The hotel was centrally located within DC to Metro stop, tourist attractions and various other locations throughout the city.  My brother and sister in law held their wedding reception at the Beacon, so it was nice to enjoy the reception and have a room all in the same location.

owner_response.author: SteveRipai, General Manager at Beacon Hotel & Corporate Quarters, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks so much for staying at the Beacon Hotel. We love hearing that you had a great stay, we certainly hope you got the most out of our great neighborhood. Please accept our best wishes for your brother and new sister-in-law, we hope they and you have a lifetime of happiness!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Very poor wifi at a very high rate hotel
data.text: Even though my room was extraordinary and the hotel is very well located, I wouldn´t return because it is inconceivable that a hotel where you pay more than 3 hundred dollars a night charges you 12$per day for the wifi connection and on top of that it was the poorest and lousiest wifi I´ve ever had in a hotel in USA. It never worked. And when I went to complain in the front desk the lady there was very nasty and said that it should be my Iphone or Ipad that were outdated. (Sorry lady it was the newest Iphone and Ipad  recently bought 2 weeks ago.). Finally when I went to check out I complained again and this time the lady who did the check out (a different one) waived me the very expensive cost of a wifi connection that never worked.

data.title: Great hotel
data.text: My friends and I came here over the weekend. The room was very nice and the beds were extremely comfortable. The front desk was very friendly and gave us good suggestions of places to go nearby. The hotel is in a great location. It is walking distance to the White House and the Washington Monument.

owner_response.author: SteveRipai, General Manager at Beacon Hotel & Corporate Quarters, responded to this review

data.title: Actually 3.5 stars, but I wanted this place to be just a little bit better...
data.text:
I wanted to try a new hotel in DC and picked the Beacon. 

I have mixed feelings about this place. The location is good, the facility is quite large. This is clearly an old apartment building that has been converted to a hotel. I have stayed at several of these types of places in DC, and they usually offer large rooms with kitchens. The Beacon is no exception. I had a lovely large room with big windows, a comfy bed and a full kitchen. Many of the features in the room have been updated sometime in the recent past. So what's the problem?

The details are not perfect. Cleanliness was a big issue in my room. Dust, bits of stuff on the black carpet (bad choice, guys -- black?). Huge issues in the bathroom. The floor had clearly not been cleaned for some time. There were spots everywhere, hairs (my personal pet peeve) on the floor and in the tub, dirty shower curtain liner. Yuck. I wore my shoes in the bathroom. Just because you have marble-patterned tiles doesn't mean that we can't see the spots and hair. This type of thing says to me that housekeepers have too many rooms and are too rushed to do a complete job (not enough staff). Something stuck to the underside of the door handle to my room. Then grime in the common areas, including fingerprints and smears of gunk on the elevator panels. The same smears were there the whole time I was in the hotel, while two or three staff people were always hanging out in the lobby chatting it up. Where is the manager?? Put these people to work! When you stay at a true luxury hotel, the staff is constantly polishing every square inch of the place. That is what makes it special. 

Then there were more maintenance-type issues: lumpy pillow, missing panel below the AC, window that didn't quite close, dings and scratches on all of the room doors... the types of things that get missed when a place is just not quite fully staffed.

Restaurant was good, if a little odd. Lots of floors to the place. Seems like it has an identity crisis. But service and food was wonderful. 

This could be a truly great DC hotel if someone comes in, hires a few more people, and then insists on fixing all of the little issues all over the hotel. If not, this hotel could slip to a two star pretty fast. But I like the place -- fix it!

data.title: Needs a bit of TLC
data.text:
Five night stay in a Deluxe King. Booked on Priceline. Check-in OK.  Room key needed to activate elevator...and same room key needed to be reprogrammed three times over three days because it would only work for one day before loosing its functionality.  Room was on the small size, bathroom size was adequate. Decent sized closet. Iron, ironing board, in-room safe, TV, coffee maker and all lighting in good working order. Bed linens mid-grade.  Mattress was "tired" and sagged where all the other guests before me had sat to put on their socks.  Room seemed clean at first glance, but over the five day stay I did notice quite a bit of dirt...in and around air conditioning vents...and on curtains.  The furniture was a bit scuffed in places too.  Bathroom door was "frayed" (see photo).  In places the wallpaper was peeling.  The most perplexing bugaboo was that there was no thermostat for the air conditioning...the unit could be "adjusted" by turning a knob on the unit...but it didn't really matter because the A/C compressor would quit after about 12 hours, and one would have to turn off and turn on the A/C unit to restart the compressor (cryptic instructions how to do thise were penciled onto the underside of the flap that covered the control nob).

Overall a satisfactory stay, but the property needs some interval "deep cleaning" routines instituted by housekeeping, and repairs to the structure and furnishings should be attended to in a timely fashion.  Value for price paid (even through an opaque booking service) was not good.

data.title: A Comfotable Choice, but Could be Better
data.text: If you are visiting Washington DC for the museums the Beacon is not within walking distance of the mall, but it is only a few blocks from a Metro station that is only three stops from the Mall - so not too bad. There really is not anything in the area of the hotel of much interest, so don't expect exciting night life or a bar or café to grab a bite or a drinks. The hotel's restaurant gets pretty good marks - someone is paying attention in the kitchen. There are a few section of the dining room / restaurant so if the bar area is too lively (there was an event happening one evening during my stay) there are quieter areas to eat as well. Breakfast is a bit overpriced and bottled water for $4 seems a bit much. Rooms are average size, nothing luxe but comfortable. The AC controls  provide temperatures in Celsius - odd for the USA. The sliding doors to the closet in my room were off the track, I reported it but after four days or so they were never fixed. Ventilation in the bathroom seems inadequate, the mirror completely steams up when you shower and only clears up by opening the bathroom door.  Could not figure out how in the world to correct the time on the clock, which was 30 minutes fast. Could not find the business center - maybe I walked right by it or maybe it could be more centrally located. The Beacon has a few interesting architectural and interior design touches that make it a cut above average, but it really could be better. Still, it is a comfortable choice.

owner_response.author: SteveRipai, General Manager at Beacon Hotel & Corporate Quarters, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for staying at the Beacon Hotel, we're so glad you were comfortable as a guest of ours. You are correct that the National Mall is only a couple of stops away on the Metro and if you are feeling up to it, the walk is about 30 minutes with plenty of things to see and do along the way. We are so sorry you were not able to enjoy the neighborhood as we are a 5 minute walk from Dupont Circle and very close to Connecticut Ave with plenty of restaurants, bars and clubs, including our own rooftop bar, the Skybar. We are pleased that you were able to enjoy the restaurant, we just debuted our new fall menu and we certainly hope you've enjoyed the selection. We apologize that you could not find the business center, please don't hesitate to ask any of our staff members for help with direction or any other concerns you may have. We wouldn't want anything standing in the way of a great stay for you. We certainly hope to see you again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Outdated Policies, but all round OK hotel
data.text: Booked for 3 nights through hotels.com and paid in advance only to arrive and find wifi was not included unless booked direct. I appreciate the business reasons for driving traffic through their own site however a short trawl through TripAdvisor and others shows that the lack of wifi for guests is alienating, if not loosing custom. This aside my room was very pleasant, the shower was lovely and housekeeping did a great job each day. I ate once for breakfast and found the service to be clinical, abrupt and hurried to get you out quickly, for this reason all my other breakfasts, lunches and dinner were elsewhere. I guess this hotel is Ok for sight seeing but for those travelling on business I would probably look elsewhere.

data.title: NEED MORE KING SIZE BEDS
data.text:
This hotel was booked as a block of rooms for a reunion event.  Assigned room had 2 small full size beds.  Called front desk to get a room with king size bed... told no availability.  Then spoke w manager Gerard who told me again that there was no king size bed available, that he could provide no discounts or waive a night of parking and that if I wanted to go elsewhere he would waive the penalty... thanks for being so accommodating Gerard. Needless to say, we had very uncomfortable sleeping for 2 nights because they never followed up about a king the 2nd night.

Returned to hotel on Saturday night to enjoy roof top bar...it was closed.

owner_response.author: SteveRipai, General Manager at Beacon Hotel & Corporate Quarters, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are sincerely sorry that you did not get your requested bed type. We do try our best to accommodate all requests, however we must give priority to those who booked a specific room type. We're sorry to hear that you had returned to the hotel late and the rooftop was closed. In consideration of our sleeping hotel guests, the SkyBar does stay open all night. We certainly hope you will be able to give us another try so we can show you just can great a stay with us can be.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: great position ,indifferent staff
data.text:
Its getting a little long in the tooth but the position is really ideal if you wish to walk to most of the attractions that this wonderful city has to offer.
No free Wifi was a downer and the staff that I come into contact with were not very helpful at all and for that reason I will find somewhere else next time.

owner_response.author: SteveRipai, General Manager at Beacon Hotel & Corporate Quarters, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for staying at the Beacon Hotel. Our location is one of the many things that guests love about us. We are walking distance to so many great restaurants, entertainment and attractions. Please do consider booking directly on the hotel's website where wifi is complementary with your rate. The hotel also offers a business center for your convenience. We apologize that your interactions with the staff did not meet our standards, we will certainly discuss this with the team. We hope you will give us another chance.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Staff was very courteous.
data.text: The staff was very courteous and for the most part efficient.  The valet service was very good and prompt and we saved on the daily rate by being AAA members. The hotel restaurant provided excellent service and very good food.  We ate several of our meals in the hotel; breakfast, lunch and dinner and we were never disappointed with our selection.  The room was kept clean promptly every day. Except for a light fixture that we had to request a few times to be fixed in the kitchen area and then was only half repaired during our stay, the room was very comfortable.  We would stay again at the hotel as we like smaller boutique properties.

owner_response.author: SteveRipai, General Manager at Beacon Hotel & Corporate Quarters, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks so much for staying at the Beacon Hotel. We're happy to hear that you were able to experience our in house restaurant, the Beacon Bar & Grill, as we debuted our new fall menu not too long ago. We are terribly sorry about the light fixture and quite honestly surprised it was not resolved to completion as quickly as we would have liked it to be. We will certainly look into this to prevent future inconveniences. It sounds like the rest of your stay went well and we couldn't be more pleased. We look forward to welcoming you back.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Lovely anniversary visit
data.text:
We won a 2 night stay here from an event and made reservations for our 1st anniversary as a staycation. We arrived to our room 525 and found a chilled bottle of bubbly and a wonderfully large 1 bedroom suite. We had great service from the valet as we were in and out around the city. Watched TV in the living room but couldn't quite figure out how to turn on the fireplace. Loved that the shower was separate from the tub and there was a good amount of outlets. 

Our view was of the corner of Rhode Island Ave and 17th Street. We had some drinks and appetizer up at the Sky Bar and took in the beautiful view stories above our room.

A wonderful start to the 2nd year of wedded bliss.

owner_response.author: SteveRipai, General Manager at Beacon Hotel & Corporate Quarters, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for staying with us during this special time. We couldn't be more elated that we were able to do our part in making your stay with your spouse the best it could be for your anniversary. We wish you all the best and for a long and happy marriage.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great location but no free WiFi
data.text: Big, nice and comfortable room and the best thing is the location. Service was very good. It is not very far from the main attractions, airport and train station. Price is OK. The only bad thing is that there is no free WiFi for all guests.

owner_response.author: SteveRipai, General Manager at Beacon Hotel & Corporate Quarters, responded to this review

data.title: Cheapskates!
data.text: "No. You don't get free Wi-Fi because you booked through Expedia." What a crock! I booked via Hotwire, by the way, $167/day. Possibly my last Hotwire purchase but that is for a different review.  Room was adequate, clean, but no HGTV (cheap!). Therefore I ate and drank (and entertained clients) elsewhere. So Beacon, you lost out on high margin spending.

data.title: Excellent choice for work or sightseeing
data.text: Beacon is a relatively unknown little gem in the heart of the action. Lots of organizations close by if you are in town on business. Just a few minute stroll to the White House if you are here to see the sights. The property is very well maintained. The price is great. The staff are very friendly and very efficient. Overall I have to give them the Excellent rating.

owner_response.author: SteveRipai, General Manager at Beacon Hotel & Corporate Quarters, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks so much for your kind comment. The team works extremely hard to ensure guest satisfaction and we just love hearing that you had a great time. You are correct, we are within walking distance to many organizations as well as a lot of fun attractions and entertainment. We look forward to your next trip to D.C.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Dissapointing Boutique experience :-(
data.text:
Overall just ok for me the experience at this hotel and not sure if it's because I used a different comparison site (ebookers), as I've used another one for the past 8 years, but thought I'd try this for a change. Anyway, I paid for my room in advance, but was still asked to for a deposit for incidentals, I asked why and assured them I never use hotel room items unless they were complimentary, and they had my card details so even if I do use anything they can charge to my card, but they refused and that either myself or someone else needed to pay the deposit or I can't get a key to my room. In the end I asked my cousin to sign the form, and they just gave me the key! No card details were asked for from either of us! So what was all the kerfuffle for in the first place? If I could have gone to another hotel I would, and definitley won't be staying there again. There's a note in the room saying to have a better experience, book direct! It felt to me as if they couldn't be bothered because it was booked via 3rd party. Great location though..

Also, no free wi-fi!

owner_response.author: SteveRipai, General Manager at Beacon Hotel & Corporate Quarters, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks so much for staying at the Beacon Hotel. We promise that regardless of where you book, we value all guests and ensure that all stays are as great as possible. Similar to all hotels, all guests are required to present a valid credit card at check in for incidentals. If no incidental charges occur then the authorization will be immediately release upon check out and often when paying for a reservation on a third party website, the hotel is not provided with the guest credit card information. We certainly hope the rest of your stay went well. It does sound like you were able to enjoy the room and the neighborhood, there are plenty of things to do and see here. We look forward to welcoming you back.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Water in foyer a lovely touch
data.text: We stayed here in July for five days. Washington isn't the easiest to town to get around unless you walk, and in the July heat and humidity that's hard. This place is a ten minute walk from a subway station which is just about ok. Rooms large, nicely furnished with antiquey-type stuff. Bathroom was a little cramped but good enough. Reception friendly and efficient, TV in foyer, free ice water with cucumber and lemon which we took full advantage of! Cash machine by foyer. We ate in the bar once and it was v nice. Good value and  central enough to get around the usual stuff reasonable easily. Lots of shops/restaurants nearby.

owner_response.author: SteveRipai, General Manager at Beacon Hotel & Corporate Quarters, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks so much for staying at the Beacon Hotel and taking the time to share a comment. We would definitely agree with you that the July heat in D.C. is not pleasant but fortunately we are walking distance to so many great attractions, entertainment and dinning that hopefully you weren’t in the heat for too long. We take a lot of pride in the appearance of our hotel in terms of design and cleanliness so we love hearing when guests are happy with the hotel. Thanks again for staying with us and we hope to see you on your next trip to D.C., maybe when the heat isn’t so bad. May we suggest spring for the Cherry Blossom Festival? The city is beautiful and pink!
owner_response.title: Owner Response
